observations: The input and output grids have the same dimensions.
1 and 6 are replaced by 7 in specific locations in the output.
If 1 and 6 are adjacent, then the 6 is replaced by 7 in the output.
If 1 and 6 are diagonal, then no change occurs.
hypotheses: Replace 6 with 7 in the output if it is horizontally or vertically adjacent to 1 in the input.
Replace the first instance of 6 with 7 in the output.
Replace 1 with 7 in the output if it is horizontally or vertically adjacent to 6 in the input.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Replace the first instance of 6 with 7 in the output.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In example 1, there are multiple instances of 6. Only some are replaced with 7.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Replace 1 with 7 in the output if it is horizontally or vertically adjacent to 6 in the input.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In example 2, 6 is not being replaced in the output, 1 is being replaced

selected_rule: Replace 6 with 7 in the output if it is horizontally or vertically adjacent to 1 in the input.
step_plan: Identify the locations of 1 and 6 in the input grid.
If 6 is horizontally or vertically adjacent to 1, replace the value of 6 with 7 in the corresponding output grid cell.
If 1 and 6 are diagonal, then leave values unchanged.
